data.description: Career Area:Students and GraduatesJob Description:Your Work Shapes the World at Caterpillar Inc. When you join Caterpillar, you're joining a global team who cares not just about the work we do – but also about each other.  We are the makers, problem solvers, and future world builders who are creating stronger, more sustainable communities. We don't just talk about progress and innovation here – we make it happen, with our customers, where we work and live. Together, we are building a better world, so we can all enjoy living in it.The Lafayette, IN facility has a position for Manufacturing Engineering Intern. In this position you will be responsible for assisting the Strategy and 6 Sigma group with process improvement projects in areas of manufacturing, assembly, quality, supply chain, and business processes. This department is responsible for implementing connected assets and smart manufacturing solutions as part of a digital strategy.This position is a 15 to 20 hour per week assignment during the school year with the opportunity to work 40 + hours per week during school breaks and during the summer months. This position can continue until graduation with mutual agreement of the student and manager.Major Responsibilities:Create visual tools for data analysis (dashboards, reports, databases)Support projects to connect manufacturing assets and collect process dataPerform analysis of data using software, statistics, other techniques.Serving as a resource member for 6 Sigma teams analyzing and improving processesAssist with compiling business performance measuresComplete independent projects as assignedBasic Qualifications:Currently enrolled as a full-time student in the School of Engineering or Technology (ME, IE, MET or IET, Computer Science, Data Science preferred) with a cumulative GPA of 2.8 or higher.Must be enrolled at a college/university in the Lafayette/West Lafayette area to be considered.Completed 30 semester hours prior to start of internship.If a transfer student, must have 12 semester hours completed at a 4-year university.Expected graduation should be May 2027 and beyond.Experience using computer-based programs to organize, access, analyze dataFamiliarity with data analysis through statistics, data analyticsDesire to learn applications related to controls, cloud computing, machine learningPreferred Skills:Knowledge of SQL database querying·Experience using data visualization tools such as PowerBI or Tableau·Understanding of ETL processesIf you are interested in applying for this position, please apply online @ caterpillar.com/careers; please attach a copy of your resume and an unofficial copy of your transcripts, to your application.Caterpillar is proud of the role we play in building the world's infrastructure. The work we do drives progress for millions of people around the globe.Summary Pay Range:$25.00 - $43.00Compensation and benefits offered may vary depending on multiple individualized factors, job level, market location, job-related knowledge, skills, individual performance and experience. Please note that salary is only one component of total compensation at Caterpillar. Benefits:Subject to plan eligibility, terms, and guidelines. This is a summary list of benefits.Medical, dental, and vision benefits*Paid time off plan (Vacation, Holidays, Volunteer, etc.)*401(k) savings plans*Health Savings Account (HSA)*Flexible Spending Accounts (FSAs)*Health Lifestyle Programs*Employee Assistance Program*Voluntary Benefits and Employee Discounts*Career Development*Incentive bonus*Disability benefitsLife InsuranceParental leaveAdoption benefitsTuition Reimbursement       * These benefits also apply to part-time employeesPosting Dates:February 3, 2026 - February 12, 2026Any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a drug screen.      Caterpillar is an Equal Opportunity Employer, Including Veterans and Individuals with Disabilities.  Qualified applicants of any age are encouraged to apply.Not ready to apply? Join our Talent Community.
